intro: Mecardonia acuminata subsp. peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular mecardonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Spain and northern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in scrublands and open woodlands, thriving in regions with mild winters and hot, dry summers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
